sentences.sContent: This quasar was the only one without a known host galaxy.
sentences.sContent_eng: This quasar was the only one without a known host galaxy.
sentences.sCn: 这个类星体似乎无依无傍，不在任何一个星系当中。

sentences.sContent: But as matter spirals toward a black hole, some of it is blown away by the heat and light of the quasar.
sentences.sContent_eng: But as matter spirals toward a black hole, some of it is blown away by the heat and light of the quasar.
sentences.sCn: 但是随着物质盘旋飞向一个黑洞，它的一部分会被这个类星体的热量和光吹走。

trans.tranOther: an object in space that is similar to a star and that shines very brightly
